artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 482.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 206, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two sheets joined together; old woman with long white hair wearing a yellow headband and a garment with green ground, multicolored moths and white and blue foliage and flowers, bending down to look inside a brown box at left; seated man at right wearing an olive green garment decorated with white circles, lines and spots, with a sword on a bamboo tripod behind man to his right; pale blue ground
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫工円活 {horikō Enkatsu}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sketches by Yoshitoshi (Yoshitoshi manga 芳年漫画)
title: Picture of the demon disguised as an old woman begging to see her arm six days after Watanabe Tsuna had returned with it to Kyoto on the 9th day of the 4th lunar month 976
